name: Green Tea
description: Green tea is a type of tea that is made from Camellia sinensis leaves and buds that have not undergone the same withering and oxidation process used to make oolong teas and black teas.

name: Black Tea
description: Black tea is a type of tea that is more oxidized than oolong, green, and white teas. Black tea is generally stronger in flavor than other teas.

name: White Tea
description: White tea is a type of tea that is made from Camellia sinensis leaves and buds that are processed to minimize oxidation. White tea has a delicate flavor.

name: Oolong Tea
description: Oolong tea is a traditional Chinese tea. It is made from the leaves, buds, and stems of the Camellia sinensis plant. Oolong tea is partially oxidized, giving it a flavor that is somewhere between black and green tea.

name: Herbal Tea
description: Herbal tea is not made from the Camellia sinensis plant, like other teas. Instead, herbal teas are made from dried fruits, flowers, spices, or herbs. Herbal teas have a wide variety of flavors and health benefits.

name: Chamomile Tea
description: Chamomile tea is a popular herbal tea that is made from the flowers of the chamomile plant. Chamomile tea has a mild, sweet flavor and is often used as a natural remedy for insomnia and anxiety.
